data.title: Taste of Ireland in old Roswell
data.text: Great atmosphere meets "made from scratch" menu that presents eclectic mix of Southern and British/Irish favorites. This is my stand-by for taking out-of-town visitors and never fails. Great seasonal appetizers included butternut squash pierogies and roasted Brussels sprouts. Numerous satisfying draft beer selections and the wall of Scotch selections will please your most demanding acquaintances.

data.title: Third Stop on our Roswell Restaurant Tour
data.text: We walked a few steps down the street after our second stop looking for dessert. We walked into this establishment and felt like we entered a real Irish pub. The bartender in his Irish accent recommended the brown bread pudding and we were sold. They have a nice selection of craft beers on tap both downstairs and upstairs. There are cozy booths along the walls and firseplaces both up and down stairs. The bread pudding was divine. We can't wait for cold weather so we can come back and enjoy and irish whisky in front of the fireplace.

data.title: Great place for happy hour
data.text:
Came here for a business get together happy hour. Wonderful Irish beers on tap, in limited number of Irish whiskey choices. Very friendly and attentive staff. 

We came for beer and whiskey but ended up ordering appetizers and food. Really good authentic fresh Irish style food. Shepherds pie is one of the best I have had at any Irish pub. 

Definitely a must visit place I'd in the area.

data.title: Great pub on Canton St.
data.text: This is a true gem. When you enter you could be in the British isles. The first is excellent, the service is cheerful and the beer and whiskey selection will keep you happy.

data.title: Fun for family
data.text: Nice selection with a great avocado BLT and good Philly beef. Large kids portions. The butternut squash perogis were fantastic. ( Not sure about a spelling) Shepherd's Pie was little runny. Service was great. Great beer selection, reasonably priced. Will definitely go back.

data.title: Always a good Guinness pour
data.text: It's reliable for the Irish pub staples.  Have had a few bar bites and they're fine, including the Indian choices. But the drinks are their strength. The upstairs balcony is the best spot.

data.title: Forget everything you think you know about Irish pub fare
data.text: That's their motto - and for good reason! This place is really good. We recently discovered it and have gone twice in the last few months. Their "seat yourself at any available table" policy has served us well both times on busy Canton Street. Above average craft beer selection. Great appetizers for sharing. We've tried blue cheese and bacon crisps (tasty!) and chicken 65 (first time ever and LOVED it). They have regular favorites (fish & chips, Reuben and burgers - all good) and some more inspired dinner choices. The bangers (House made. Everyone in our group was impressed.) and mash were amazing, the curry chicken was delicious as was the shephed's pie. We've had good service from friendly staff. Love music on the weekends. Not really our thing but plenty were there to enjoy it. If you haven't checked out Mac McGee's yet. Give it a whirl!

data.title: Ambience is cute but worst......
data.text: Cute pub in great location, but the worst fish and chips I have ever had.  I figured it would be a safe bet, but No!!!! I can't even eat it, and at $18 for 1 piece of fish and some fries I was expecting glorious!

data.title: Huge serving size!
data.text: Cute pub!  The decorations are neat.  I had the potato chips with bleu cheese and bacon.....omg delish!

data.title: Wedding party
data.text: Had rehearsal party there w open bar. Food was awesome and bartenders fast and friendly. Gets a bit crowded in there, not a big space. Does have a balcony w tables if you can grab one. Good all around though.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: This is a great place to stop in for a drink and / or a meal. The food is fantastic and it is all made from scratch. They have a great beer selection too! The atmosphere inside the pub is very warm and friendly and the staff are too.

data.title: Great pub
data.text: We found this by accident and will be back.  I felt like I was in Ireland or England.  Try the jalapeño popcorn - those who didn't like spice even liked it.

data.title: Very impressed
data.text: Had lunch at Mac's. We were pleasantly surprised at the fresh,  local ingredients. Our server was friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

data.title: My local joint
data.text: If you are in the mood for a semi cold Guinness, which is how it should be served, not ice cold like most American beers, this is the place.  The staff, especially Fred and their lovable bouncer Marion,are a pleasure to talk to.  The food is hardy and good, music is fantastic, but it's the people that make me want to return on a weekly basis. Cead mil failte🇨🇮🍀

data.title: Irish Pub in Conflict
data.text:
Two of us went for dinner on Wednesday night. My quest had a bacon burger and I had the Corn Beef Entree with Fingerling Potato Colcannon. The inside is almost all wood and gives the feeling of an old Irish pub. The burger came as ordered except they did not have any bbq sauce. Mine had large thick pieces of corned beef that was very tender and broke apart with a fork. The colcannon part was one of the best I have had. 
The conflict mentioned in the title is that they also had an Indian dish and a curry dish. Never seen that in an Irish Pub. Beer and liquor prices were reasonable, the burger i thought was overpriced and my dinner I thought was under priced. Service was a little on the lacking side. All in all I would go back.

data.title: British Isles fare in Roswell
data.text: The last Downton Abbey...sigh. We just had to have a UK dinner! So off to MacMcGee's for a delicious "breakfast stout" (stout for breakfast?) that had coffee and chocolate favors. Delicious! That was accompanied by an app special - bacon wrapped, goat cheese filled dates. Yum! My Shepherds Pie was too hot to eat, even after 15-20 minutes. But my husband liked his fish and chips and we both liked the Brussels sprouts salad. We sat upstairs and found another entire bar and pub space, complete with outdoor balcony. Really great atmosphere. I'll try something else to eat,though, next time.

data.title: Always consistent always good!
data.text: Mac McGee's is a favorite spot - great food and the staff is wonderful - special shout out to Erin, Fred and the chef!  You make Tuesday nights great for our group.  We love all of the salads!

data.title: Super Bourbon collection
data.text: Great food!  enjoyed the side of brussel sprouts - excellent!   We also had fish and chips, Cottage pie, and great beer selection.

data.title: an afternoon delight
data.text:
Found this oasis of Irish heaven while traveling with two friends back to Atlanta from Texarkana.  The original plan was to pop in for a sandwich and an ice cold coca cola after being on the road almost 28 hours then head on down to the motor speedway to meet our travel deadline.    

Those plans and our bet with Big Enos all went out the window when our food arrived.  I started my meal with the sausage rolls.   Homemade sausage in a puff pastry !  Sweet 5 pound 9 once Baby Jesus, I had to wash that down with a beer.  By the time my braised short rib sandwich arrived I was knee deep in Harp and not looking to be rescued. 

My friend Cledus was traveling with his hound Fred so we opted to sit out front on one of the comfortable pub tables and watch the scenic view of Canton Street residents stroll by.   And I mean scenic…..   Cletus went with the house lamb gyro and chips based on our server Jessica’s recommendation and he was not disappointed.  A generous sandwich with enough house cut fries for even Fred to sample.   Jessica was so kind to even bring a small bowl of water for Fred to wash down his snack.   Fred fancies a good fry.  

The third member of our group Sally, aka Frog, selected the roasted brussel sprout salad and one of their house cocktails called The Peaky Blinder.   Excellent and Excellent!  Not being a salad man, it was surprising to find myself eating off of her plate during lunch.  Maybe it was the harp making me frisky?

After spending a few quality hours out front, Frog and I went inside for a tour.  What struck us most was the beer options.  Over 30 drafts on 2 floors was a nice change of pace from the 400 cases of coors we had just spent hauling thru four states.   If I ever traveled out of the south, this is what I imagine Ireland would look like!

Can’t wait to return to our new home away from home, everyone loves a good sequel.

data.title: Very enjoyable!
data.text: Was a beautiful day, so looked for outdoor seats in downtown Roswell to have a drink and a bite. Found this pub. Excellent pour of a Guinness draft. Some tasty apps...really enjoyed the chicken 65.  The upstairs bartender Cody was great. Nice upstairs outside porch.
